metadata.title: CVE-2019-5718 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In Wireshark 2.6.0 to 2.6.5 and 2.4.0 to 2.4.11, the RTSE dissector andother ASN.1 dissectors could crash. This was addressed in epan/charsets.cby adding a get_t61_string length check.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5718` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.6-1~ubuntu16.04.0
libwireshark11 - 2.6.6-1~ubuntu16.04.0
libwiretap8 - 2.6.6-1~ubuntu16.04.0
libwscodecs2 - 2.6.6-1~ubuntu16.04.0
libwsutil9 - 2.6.6-1~ubuntu16.04.0
tshark - 2.6.6-1~ubuntu16.04.0
wireshark - 2.6.6-1~ubuntu16.04.0
wireshark-common - 2.6.6-1~ubuntu16.04.0
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.6-1~ubuntu16.04.0
wireshark-qt - 2.6.6-1~ubuntu16.04.0
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.6-1~ubuntu16.04.0').
